results.title: The Anzac Story
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm, Frank Hunter and ABC
results.brief_description: This video contains two programs pertaining to the history of the Anzacs using archival footage, drawings and stills and narrated by Barry Lineham. “Prelude to glory” - Presents a brief historical overview of Captain Cook’s landings in New Zealand and Australia and the following events which took place including colonisation, the chain of British governors, a Treaty with the Maoris, Federation in Australia, and the eventual lead up to World War I. With the advent of the War came the formation of the Anzac Corps, an alliance between the Australian and New Zealand defence forces, and a commitment by the Anzacs to fight for the British Empire in a war half a world away. Shows the sailing of the first convoy, the naval battle and sinking of the German battle ship “Emden” and the arrival of the Anzacs in Egypt. “Gallipoli” - Tells the story of this ill-fated war against the Turks, the tragic mistakes, the chaos and disorganisation, and the horrendous loss of young Anzacs (10,000 soldiers) from the botched up landing on 25 April 1915 in a small bay south of Ari Burnu (renamed Anzac Cove) to the eventual evacuation of all troops in December 1915.

results.title: Living with happiness
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt and Sarah Watt Productions
results.brief_description: A young mother finds herself gripped by an overwhelming pessimism that threatens to consume her. Only a freak accident on a lonely beach may be the key to her future happiness. Voices performed by Sigrid Thornton and William McInnes. (Awards: Winner, Emirates AFI Award for Best Animation, 2001)

results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 02?]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: 1. A lesson in geography - shows the size of Australia in relation to Scandinavia and Europe. 2. Warburton District - located on the Great Dividing Range, Victoria, shows scenery and inhabitants. 3. The Princes Highway - from Lakes Entrance to Narooma inlet. Shows Lakes Entrance locals and holiday-makers; an Aborigine fishing with a spear; Narooma’s beautiful inlet; oyster fishing and eating. 4. Animal bandits - animals dance to the sound of birds; they form a band but their tunes are unbearable until they attend Professor Heron’s school of music.

results.title: The Visit to Victoria of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh
results.brief_description: A unique record of an outstanding historical event, the arrival at Essendon Airport on 24 February 1954, of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh and their subsequent tour of the State of Victoria. Photographed by a large team of professional cameramen, in privileged positions, the film contains such exclusive scenes as the opening of State Parliament and the Royal Command Performance at the Princess Theatre, visits to Hamilton, Benalla, Sale, Traralgon, Yallourn and Mildura; races at Flemington; Flinders Naval Depot; and The University of Melbourne. The film captures all the excitement of the great occasion and shows many interesting sidelights of the Royal progress throughout the State.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Jamie Blanks and Hugh Burton
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.

results.title: Ivan Durrant (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Australian artist Ivan Durrant is infamously known for killing a cow and depositing it at the entrance of the National Gallery of Victoria in the late 60’s. It was to accompany another of his well-known art pieces, “The Butcher Shop”, housed at the gallery in their permanent collection. One of Australia’s most accomplished photo-realist artists, Durrant’s paintings are featured alongside his sculptural works in this documentary. His subjects stem from childhood memories and mostly centre around images of cattle and pigs, with man’s violence against animals featuring in more esoteric ways in works like, “the quality meat show”. Looking broadly, his work is preoccupied with perception and how we choose to box or see things, or refuse to consider the more difficult truths about ourselves. Contained within this video are some images of cruelty against animals, with excerpts from Durrant’s film “Chopping Blocks” that is particularly disturbing in content. Please note: both U-matic and VHS copy have poor quality sound.

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.brief_description: Bali II described as a “gem of the Dutch East Indies”. This travelogue concentrates on the traditions of Bali - its agriculture and markets, and cultural practices.
